contribution.title: Your Contribution
contribution.overBy: You're over by {{amount}}. The limit for 2024 is {{limit}}.
contribution.cannotSaveOverLimit: Reduce your contribution to save changes

paycheck.title: Contribution Impact
paycheck.savingsExplainer: Contributing {{contribution}} only costs you {{realCost}} thanks to tax savings!
paycheck.rothExplainer: Your {{contribution}} Roth contribution is after-tax, so no immediate tax savings.

accountInfo.title: Account Information
accountInfo.matchExplainer: Contribute {{cap}}% or more to get the full {{effective}}% match

errors.loadFailed: Failed to load data. Please try again.
errors.saveFailed: Failed to save contribution. Please try again.
errors.networkError: Network error. Please check your connection.

tooltips.traditional: Pre-tax contributions reduce your taxable income now. You'll pay taxes when you withdraw in retirement.
tooltips.roth: After-tax contributions mean you pay taxes now, but withdrawals in retirement are tax-free.
tooltips.fica: FICA (Federal Insurance Contributions Act) includes Social Security (6.2%) and Medicare (1.45%) taxes.
tooltips.employerMatch: Your employer contributes additional money to your 401(k) based on how much you contribute.
tooltips.irsLimit: The IRS sets annual limits on how much you can contribute to your 401(k). Those 50+ can contribute extra (catch-up contributions).
tooltips.taxSavings: Traditional 401(k) contributions reduce your taxable income, lowering the taxes you pay now.
